intro: Zilla biparmata, commonly known as the mountain zilla, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Zilla biparmata is adapted to cold, mountainous environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
